snippet: Surface tablet computers, custom-made for in-game use, demonstrate the evolving relationships between leagues and sponsors.
abstract: Microsoft's toughened tablet computers designed for NFL, downloading high-definition photographs of plays moments after they occur, have blended into the sidelines; their development offers a window into the relationship between the NFL and its business partners, particularly those vying for one of the few spots on a field that tens of millions of fans see every week.

byline.contributor: Bill Pennington contributed reporting from East Rutherford, N.J., and Ben Shpigel from Cortland, N.Y.

lead_paragraph: Surface tablet computers, custom-made for in-game use, demonstrate the evolving relationships between leagues and sponsors.

headline.main: Microsoft Wins a Spot on the N.F.L. Sideline
headline.print_headline: Microsoft Wins a Spot on the N.F.L. Sideline
